intro: Brunnichia congoensis, commonly known as the Congo brunnichia, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Brunnichia congoensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
